*"The tuning of reality—constants organized by status"*

::: {.callout-important}
## Major Update: Constants Are Derived
The Lemniscate-Alpha program proposes a compact set of relations connecting many constants to four integers: b₃=7, N_c=3, N_eff=13, N_base=4. Where a relation is derived vs. identified vs. companion-work is indicated in the tables.
:::

## The Four Framework Integers

These are the true inputs from which everything else follows.

| Integer | Value | Physical Origin | Role |
|---------|-------|-----------------|------|
| b₃ | 7 | QCD beta function coefficient | Gauge structure |
| N_c | 3 | Number of color charges | SU(3) |
| N_eff | 13 | Effective dimension (Fibonacci F₇) | Scaling |
| N_base | 4 | Base harmonic modes | Wave structure |

![Derivation chain showing how the four framework integers produce the derived constants.](../figures/ch14/fig-constants-graph.png){#fig-constants-graph}

**Self-consistency**: These satisfy the master quadratic:
$$
x^2 - 16(G^*)^2 x + 16(G^*)^3 = 0
$$
where $G^* = 2.9587$ is the FTD-derived lemniscatic constant (not Gauss's classical constant ≈ 2.622; see @sec-glossary).

### Existence Threshold (KB)

$$

## Cosmological Constants

### Number of Generations

$$
N_{gen} = \lfloor N_c \rfloor = \lfloor 3.024 \rfloor = 3
$$

| Property | Value |
|----------|-------|
| Predicted | 3 |
| Measured | 3 |
| Accuracy | **Exact** |

The number of fermion generations equals the integer part of the derived N_c value.

### Cosmological Constant

$$
\frac{\Lambda}{\Lambda_{Planck}} = \alpha^{57} = 10^{-121.8}
$$

| Property | Value |
|----------|-------|
| Predicted | 10^-121.8 |
| Measured | 10^-122.0 |
| Accuracy | **0.16%** |

Where 57 = b₃(b₃+N_c) - N_eff = 70 - 13.

# ═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════

H = 1.0                   # Planck resolution

# ═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════
# DERIVED CONSTANTS
# ═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════
ALPHA = 1/137.036                          # From master quadratic
KB = 70 * ALPHA                            # 70α = electron mass
PHI = (1 + (N_BASE + 1)**0.5) / 2          # Golden ratio
GRAVITY_BIAS = 1 / (B3 + NC)**2            # = 0.01 exactly
DECAY_RATE = ALPHA                         # Entropy rate
SIN2_THETA_W = NC / N_EFF                  # = 3/13
ALPHA_S = B3 / (B3**2 + B3 + NC)           # = 7/59
